meanings.definition: A building containing several separate theaters for simultaneous screenings.
meanings.sent1: We went to the multiplex to watch the latest movies with our friends.
meanings.sent2: The multiplex in our town always has a variety of films playing at the same time.
meanings.sent3: The multiplex was so crowded that we had to sit in the front row and crane our necks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a multiplex, with different thoughts playing out on different screens.
meanings.sent5: The multiplex was like a maze, with each theater leading to a different movie experience.

meanings.definition: A system of transmitting several messages or signals simultaneously on the same circuit or channel.
meanings.sent1: The multiplex technology allowed us to send multiple signals through one wire.
meanings.sent2: In telecommunications, a multiplex is essential for efficient data transmission.
meanings.sent3: The multiplex system was so advanced that it could handle numerous calls at once.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the multiplex of wires, reaching every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The multiplex of information flowing through the network was like a symphony of data.

meanings.sent1: The multiplex project involved various teams working on different components.
meanings.sent2: His multiplex approach to problem-solving considered all angles before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The multiplex nature of the task made it challenging but also exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a multiplex puzzle, with many layers waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The multiplex design of the building showcased the architect's creativity in every detail.
